questions.question: In the GI/M/c/N queueing system, what does 'GI' represent?

answers.b: General probability distribution for service times

explanations.a: Incorrect. 'GI' does not represent a geometric arrival process in the GI/M/c/N notation.
explanations.b: Correct. In GI/M/c/N, 'GI' stands for a general probability distribution for arrival times, allowing for diverse arrival patterns.
explanations.c: Incorrect. 'GI' does not represent a Gaussian arrival pattern.
explanations.d: Incorrect. 'GI' does not refer to Green's function for queue analysis.

questions.question: What does the '5' parameter signify in the GI/M/5/N queueing model?

answers.a: Average number of arrivals per unit time
answers.b: Maximum number of customers in the system
answers.c: Number of servers in the system

explanations.a: Incorrect. The 'c' parameter does not represent the average number of arrivals per unit time.
explanations.b: Incorrect. 'c' does not represent the maximum number of customers in the system; 'N' does.
explanations.c: Correct. In the GI/M/c/N model, 'c' signifies the number of servers in the system serving customers concurrently.
explanations.d: Incorrect. 'c' does not represent the service rate of the server.

questions.question: What impact does increasing the number of servers 'c' have on the GI/M/c/N queueing system?

answers.b: Increases the probability of system overflow
answers.d: Lowers the variability in service times

explanations.a: Correct. Increasing the number of servers 'c' typically reduces the average waiting time as more servers are available to serve customers concurrently.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Increasing 'c' often decreases the probability of system overflow by providing more capacity to handle incoming arrivals.
explanations.c: Incorrect. While increasing 'c' can contribute to stability in certain cases, it does not inherently enhance system stability.
explanations.d: Incorrect. The number of servers 'c' does not directly affect the variability in service times; it primarily influences system capacity.

questions.question: How does increasing the value of 'N' affect the behavior of the GI/M/c/N queueing system?

answers.b: Increases the probability of system overflow

explanations.a: Incorrect. Increasing 'N' may increase the average waiting time as more customers can be accommodated, leading to longer queues.
explanations.b: Correct. Increasing 'N' increases the capacity of the system, potentially reducing the likelihood of overflow.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Increasing 'N' does not affect the number of servers in the system.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Increasing 'N' may or may not enhance system stability, depending on other factors.
